Dear Ms. Ellison:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 10/28/2021. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
The violations that were found are:
R 400.10113 Employee records.
Employee records shall be maintained for each employee and
shall include all of the following information:
(d) Three references which are obtained before employment
from persons unrelated to the employee.
 7 out of 11 employee files for staff hired within the last year lacked
documentation that references were completed.
 1 out of 11 employees hired within the last year only had documentation of 2
references in his file.
R 400.10113 Employee records.
(e) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations.
6 out of 11 employee files for staff hired within the last year lacked documentation
that a criminal history check was completed.

R 400.10113 Employee records.
(f) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within the
first 6 months of each position designated by these rules and
annually thereafter.
4 out of 18 employee files that were reviewed did not have current evaluations.
R 400.10115 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
A facility shall document that each employee and each
volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or more hours per
week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free from
communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 3-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 3 years after the last
verification.
8 of 18 employee files reviewed did not have documentation that a TB test was
completed.
R 400.10125 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(2) A facility shall document that each direct care worker
participated in 40 hours of planned orientation preceding
independent assignment to direct care functions. The orientation
shall include the following:
1 of 11 employees hired in the last year did not have documentation that 40 hours of
orientation was completed.
R 400.10125 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) In addition to the orientation training, a facility shall
document that each direct care worker received 24 clock hours
of planned training annually.
6 out of 18 employees did not have documentation that 24 hours of training was
completed in the last year.
During this last year the facility has had a change in management resulting in the systems
previously in place have been lost. They are working on a way to provide training to staff
that only work on an on-call basis in order to meet the required 24 hours of training. The
facility has also experienced an increase in violent offenders who end up staying for
longer periods of time.
Technical assistance is being provided for the facility to ensure that all staff files, including
staff that transfer from other departments, meet the employee records rule. Further the
facility should have all employee file documentation available to the consultant at the time
of the on-site inspection. This can be available in hard copy form or electronically.
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
2

 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
The Department provides technical assistance to meet the licensing requirements and
consultation to improve services.
Please contact me with any questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need
to speak to someone immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
